intro: Senecio paulsenii, commonly known as the Paulsen's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, hairy seeds. Senecio paulsenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience in dry conditions.
